title: Northern Territory awarded again for its recreational fishing - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Northern Territory awarded again for its recreational fishing Published on : Tuesday, August 18, 2015
Recreational anglers across the Territory have until the end of the week to nominate for the inaugural Northern Territory Recreational Fishing Awards 2015.
Minister for Primary Industry and Fisheries Willem Westra van Holthe said entries have been reeling in and encouraged anglers to nominate either themselves, or someone they know, before it is too late.
“This gala event is going to be a wonderful evening, recognising individuals and organisations for their contribution to the conservation, restoration and enhancement of the Territory’s recreational fisheries and their habitat,” Minister Westra van Holthe said.
“We have worked closely with the Amateur Fishermen’s Association of the Northern Territory (AFANT) to get this key Country Liberals Government election commitment afloat.
“Around 32, 000 recreational anglers use Territory waterways annually and the industry is worth more than $80 million to our economy every year; the Northern Territory Government is proud to support this inaugural event,” Minister Westra van Holthe.
Nominations are open in the following categories:
· Individual Award
· Youth (under 21)
· Fishing Tourism Operation (lodge, charter boat or guided fishing operation)
· Fishing Media / writer / personality or show
· Fishing Competition
· Territory’s Top Fishing Researcher
· Fishing Art Award
AFANT’s Tristan Sloan said the much-anticipated event is a wonderful way to recognise the contribution the recreational fishing industry makes to the Territory.
“Fishing in the Territory is world-renowned, we have a unique environment and enviable lifestyle and it’s great to have the opportunity to celebrate that,” Mr Sloan said.
“From the winners of the Northern Territory Recreational Fishing Awards 2015, an overall Recreational Fishing Gold winner will be chosen.”
The Recreational Fishing Advisory Committee will consider all nominations and provide award recommendations to Minister Westra van Holthe.
